Best For Smoothness

Naturium The Perfector Salicylic Acid Body Wash

Pros

  • Decongests the skin to prevent irritation

Cons

  • Takes a while to see results

As the name suggests, The Perfector, by the internet‚Äôs favorite rising skin care brand Naturium, gently exfoliates away impurities to reveal smoother, clearer, healthier skin. The fragrance-free formula is a godsend for those who have sensitive skin. It is a slow burn, but the long-term results are worth the wait.

Active ingredients: Salicylic acid

Size

: 16.9 fl oz

Amazon star rating: 4.4/5 stars

An ELLE Editor says: ‚ÄúNothing has cleared my body acne faster than this Naturium body wash. My breakouts probably scream in fear whenever they feel this salicylic acid-infused gel formula on my skin. It‚Äôs gentle, effective, and fragrance-free.‚Äù‚ÄîNerisha Penrose, beauty commerce editor

Kosas Good Body Skin AHA + Enzyme Exfoliating Body Wash

Pros

  • Gentle enough for daily use

Thanks to a wonderful blend of fruit enzymes and powerful AHAs, your skin is stripped of the bad stuff, such as dead skin, clogged pores, and dark marks, to reduce frequent breakouts.

Active ingredients: Glycolic, lactic, and mandelic acid

Size

: 9 fl oz

Sephora star rating: 4.1/5 stars

A Sephora reviewer said: ‚ÄúI have KP on my arms and so far this has been the only exfoliator to actually help reduce redness and inflammation! Very gentle on the skin and has a nice, light scent!‚Äù

Niacinamide, kale, and green tea extracts offer soothing properties as all the dirt and debris are gently cleansed off your skin. 16.4 oz

Scent aside, the niacinamide and superfoods packed in this bottle blanket my skin with nourishment I haven‚Äôt felt from a body cleanser in a long time. Couple it with the body butter, and you‚Äôll garner compliments from the moment you step outside.‚Äù‚ÄîNerisha Penrose, beauty commerce editor

Glytone Exfoliating Body Wash

With a high percentage of glycolic acid (8.8 percent, to be exact), Glytone‚Äôs Exfoliating Body Wash may seem a bit intimidating. Worry not: this body wash stops breakouts in their tracks within days and makes your skin feel rejuvenated after each wash.

Active ingredients: Glycolic acid

Size

: 6.7 fl oz

Dermstore star rating: 4.6/5 stars

A Dermstore reviewer said: ‚ÄúI was scared to try this, but it is wonderful for my sensitive skin. I have had no reaction, and it does what it says. I can even use it on my face as an exfoliating face wash it is so gentle. Will repurchase.‚Äù

Murad Acne Control Acne Body Wash

Cons

  • Takes time to see results

Murad can be found in just about everyone‚Äôs skin care lineup, but its body wash iteration deserves just as much attention. Formulated with salicylic acid, glycolic acid, green tea, licorice root, and more, this body wash fights acne to ward off pesky bumps and calms the skin.

Size

: 8.5 fl oz

Ulta star rating: 4/5 stars

What are the benefits of acne body wash?

Of course, the number one benefit of acne body wash is exfoliation, but there are plenty more benefits, like killing bacteria. ‚ÄúAcne body washes help exfoliate the skin as well as decrease microbe growth on your body, which ultimately leads to less acne and leaves your skin feeling clean and refreshed,‚Äú says Dr. Patel.

Where does an acne body wash fall in the body care routine?

‚ÄúYou should use your acne body wash in the shower after you have washed your hair,‚Äù Dr. Patel adds. As the last step in your shower routine, ‚Äúthis ensures you will leave the shower with clean skin [after] washing off all the hair products,‚Äù she says.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

What ingredients should you look for in an acne wash?

AHAs‚Äîglycolic, lactic, malic, etc.‚Äîand BHAs‚Äîsalicylic‚Äîare the most common powerful ingredients in most acne cleansers. Dr. Patel says to look for those acids, in addition to ingredients like benzoyl peroxide, salicylic acid, tea tree oil, and bakuchiol, as these players help ‚Äúdecrease microbe growth, decrease fungus and bacteria on the skin, and minimize body breakouts.‚Äù
